title: Free Design Resources
subtitle: Tools, cheat codes, and hidden gems that don't suck

headline: Save money, save time, make cool stuff
body: Anti-corporate tools that actually feel good to use.
Design shortcuts the pros know.
Permission to steal like an artist.
Everything here is **free** or has a solid free tier.

title: üé® Color Palettes
subtitle: Never stare at a blank canvas again

headline: The essentials
body: **[Coolors](https://coolors.co)** - Super-fast palette generator that learns your taste
**[Color Hunt](https://colorhunt.co)** - Curated palettes updated daily, perfect for quick inspiration
**[Khroma](https://khroma.co)** - AI learns which colors you like, generates unlimited personalized palettes
**[Paletton](https://paletton.com)** - Advanced color wheel with split-complementary, triadic controls

headline: More palette tools
body: **[Adobe Color Explore](https://color.adobe.com/explore)** - Search user-generated palettes by keyword (try 'vaporwave' or 'nature')
**[Duo](https://duo.alexpate.uk)** - Harmonious two-color combinations for duotone effects
**[Design Seeds](https://design-seeds.com)** - Nature-inspired palettes for fresh, organic vibes

headline: Hidden gem color tools
body: **[Huemint](https://huemint.com)** - AI applies palettes to actual mockups so you see how colors perform in context
**[ColorSpace](https://mycolor.space)** - Generate 16 different palette combinations from a single hex code
**[Shade Generator](https://10015.io/tools/shade-generator)** - Precise shades/tints that maintain perfect luminosity contrast

headline: Free fonts that don't look free
body: **[Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com)** - 1000+ free fonts, easy to embed, great pairings
**[Fontshare](https://fontshare.com)** - High-quality, 100% free for personal and commercial use
**[Font Squirrel](https://fontsquirrel.com)** - Handpicked commercial-use fonts + font identifier tool
**[DaFont](https://dafont.com)** - Massive library from designers worldwide, filter by style
**[Fontpair](https://fontpair.co)** - Beautiful font pairings to copy

headline: Typography utilities
body: **[Type Scale](https://typescale.com)** - Pick a base size and ratio (e.g., 1.5 for perfect fifth), get instant hierarchy
**[Font Playground](https://play.typedetail.com)** - Browse unused alternates, ligatures, swashes from any font
**[Glyphs](https://glyphsapp.com/tools)** - Explore unique symbols and characters without learning codes

headline: High-quality, actually usable images
body: **[Unsplash](https://unsplash.com)** - 2M+ high-res images, free for commercial use
**[Pexels](https://pexels.com)** - Photos and videos, no attribution required
**[Pixabay](https://pixabay.com)** - Copyright-free images and videos
**[PikWizard](https://pikwizard.com)** - 1M+ royalty-free images without attribution
**[Pinterest](https://pinterest.com)** - Mood boards and visual research goldmine

title: üóúÔ∏è Compression & Optimization
subtitle: Make files tiny without losing quality

headline: Essential compression tools
body: **[Squoosh](https://squoosh.app)** - Google's image compressor, incredible results
**[TinyPNG](https://tinypng.com)** - Smart PNG and JPEG compression
**[SVGOMG](https://jakearchibald.github.io/svgomg/)** - Best SVG cleaner and compressor, removes junk code
**[Remove.bg](https://remove.bg)** - Fastest, most accurate background remover (free for standard res)

headline: Free editors that actually work
body: **[Photopea](https://photopea.com)** - Browser-based Photoshop clone, handles PSDs perfectly
**[GIMP](https://gimp.org)** - Open-source Photoshop alternative, powerful but has a learning curve
**[PhotoDemon](https://photodemon.org)** - Hidden gem: portable, handles all color spaces and 16/32-bit
**[Krita](https://krita.org)** - Focused on painting and drawing, intuitive for artists
**[Pixlr](https://pixlr.com)** - Browser-based with AI tools for quick edits

title: üì± Mockups & Presentation
subtitle: Make your work look professional instantly

headline: Screenshot to portfolio piece in seconds
body: **[Screely](https://screely.com)** - Turns screenshots into beautiful images with backgrounds and frames
**[Mockuuups Studio](https://mockuuups.studio)** - Real-photo device mockups (free tier available)
**[FreebiesBug](https://freebiesbug.com)** - Free PSD mockups for products, devices, apparel
**[GraphicBurger](https://graphicburger.com)** - High-quality mockup templates

title: üéØ Icons & Illustrations
subtitle: Visual elements that tie it all together

headline: Icon libraries
body: **[Iconmonstr](https://iconmonstr.com)** - Simple black/white icons, zero frills, fast SVG downloads
**[Feather Icons](https://feathericons.com)** - Simple, open-source, customizable
**[The Noun Project](https://thenounproject.com)** - Massive library for every need
**[Flaticon](https://flaticon.com)** - 7M+ vector icons in PNG, SVG, EPS, PSD
**[Ionicons](https://ionic.io/ionicons)** - Extensive free SVG icon set

headline: Illustrations that don't look generic
body: **[Blush](https://blush.design)** - Mix-and-match customizable illustrations from global artists
**[unDraw](https://undraw.co)** - 500+ free illustrations, customizable colors, PNG and SVG
**[Open Doodles](https://opendoodles.com)** - Pablo Stanley's sketches, source files included
**[Drawkit](https://drawkit.com)** - Hand-drawn vector illustrations and icons

title: ‚úèÔ∏è Vector Editors
subtitle: Logo and icon creation without Adobe

headline: Free Illustrator alternatives
body: **[Inkscape](https://inkscape.org)** - Powerful open-source vector editor, Illustrator-level features
**[Vectr](https://vectr.com)** - Simple, browser-based, great for beginners
**[Figma](https://figma.com)** - Industry-standard UI/UX tool with generous free tier

headline: Multi-purpose problem solvers
body: **[TinyWow](https://tinywow.com)** - 100+ free tools: PDF, image, video conversion, editing, compression
**[Canva](https://canva.com)** - Templates and quick graphics (free tier is solid)
**[Stylify Me](https://stylifyme.com)** - Enter any URL, scrapes colors, typography, style rules instantly
**[Get Waves](https://getwaves.io)** - Generate custom SVG wave shapes for section dividers
**[Untools](https://untools.co)** - Mental models for better thinking (First Principles, Inversion, etc.)

headline: The 2-Font Rule
body: Use a **maximum of two fonts** in a design.
One for headings (display or serif), one for body (clean sans-serif).
If you absolutely must add a third, use it for a single specialty element only.
This creates instant visual harmony and prevents chaos.

headline: The 8pt Grid System
body: All spacing and sizing should be **multiples of 8 pixels**.
Margins: 16px, 24px, 32px. Icons: 24√ó24. Buttons: 48px height.
Creates consistency and makes designs easily adaptable across screen sizes.
Professional designers swear by this.

headline: The 60-30-10 Color Rule
body: **60% Dominant color** - Backgrounds, main containers
**30% Secondary color** - Text, minor elements, sidebars
**10% Accent color** - Call-to-action buttons, links, highlights
Stolen from interior design, works perfectly for UI/web.

headline: Contrast Ratio Hack
body: Don't guess if text is readable. **Check the contrast ratio**.
Use **[WebAIM Contrast Checker](https://webaim.org/resources/contrastchecker/)**
Aim for **4.5:1** minimum for normal text, **3:1** for large text.
This isn't optional‚Äîit's accessibility law and common sense.

headline: White Space is Free Real Estate
body: Give elements room to breathe (negative space).
Makes designs feel professional, clean, intentional.
Guides the eye to what matters most.
When in doubt, **add more space**.

headline: Typography Scale Trick
body: Use a **simple multiplier** for type sizes: 1.25 or 1.333 (perfect fourth).
Example: 16px √ó 1.25 = 20px, 20px √ó 1.25 = 25px
Creates harmonious, mathematically-pleasing hierarchy.
No more guessing at font sizes.

headline: Steal the Crop
body: Don't use stock photos as-is. **Crop aggressively**.
Focus on a single compelling detail.
Create interesting negative space for text.
This is how pros make stock photos not look like stock photos.

headline: Duplicate and Simplify
body: Need a new version? **Never work on the only copy**.
Duplicate your design, then **delete half the elements**.
Simplifying a copy often leads to a better, more focused result.
Saves you from 'save as v2 v3 final FINAL' hell.

headline: Build a Swipe File
body: Screenshot or save designs you admire.
When stuck, browse your file for inspiration.
**Analyze why they work**, don't just copy them.
Your future self will thank you.

headline: The X-Height Unifier Hack
body: When pairing two different fonts, **match their x-heights**.
The x-height is the height of lowercase 'x'.
When x-heights align, fonts look harmonious even if they're completely different styles.
Visual weight and readability improve instantly.

headline: Contrast by Weight, Not Just Size
body: Don't just make headings **bigger**‚Äîmake them **bolder**.
Weight contrast (heavy/bold vs regular/light) is more powerful than size alone.
Creates stronger hierarchy without shouting.
Easier to read, looks more sophisticated.

headline: The Shadow Layer Trick
body: Never use a single shadow layer. Use **three layers** for depth:
**Layer 1:** High blur, low opacity (15px blur, 10% opacity)
**Layer 2:** Medium blur, medium opacity (5px blur, 20% opacity)
**Layer 3:** Low blur, higher opacity, tight offset (2px blur, 30% opacity, 1px offset)
Prevents flat, digital-looking shadows. Creates realistic depth.

headline: Optical Alignment (Not Mathematical)
body: When centering icons, numbers, or shapes, **don't trust the bounding box**.
A triangle or character like '7' will look off-center if mathematically centered.
Nudge it slightly until it **looks right to your eye**.
This is how pros make things feel balanced.

headline: The Invisible Line
body: Avoid centered alignment for text blocks or icon groups.
Align left (or right) to an **invisible vertical line** instead.
Creates a stronger, cleaner visual edge that the eye can follow.
Centered content often looks soft and uncommitted.

title: üìê Design Principles
subtitle: Laws and patterns that actually matter

headline: The Pareto Principle (80/20 Rule)
body: **80% of results come from 20% of effort.**
Focus on the features/elements that deliver the most impact.
Perfect is the enemy of shipped.
Ruthlessly cut the stuff that doesn't move the needle.

headline: You've got to be seen to be heard
body: Visibility creates opportunity.
If people can't find your work, it doesn't matter how good it is.
Consistency beats perfection every time.
Show up, ship often, stay findable.

headline: One thing, done right
body: Tools that do one thing perfectly beat Swiss Army knife apps.
Reduce friction until the tool disappears.
Compression is respect for attention.
Not every good idea needs to scale.

headline: Build the thing that builds the things
body: Meta-systems beat monuments.
Templates, patterns, and infrastructure enable rapid deployment.
Design systems save time in the long run.
Invest in scaffolding, not just output.

title: üí¨ Permission to Steal
subtitle: Quotes from freaks, philosophers, and weirdos

headline: Without deviation from the norm, progress is not possible
body: **‚Äî Frank Zappa**
Breaking conventions isn't just allowed‚Äîit's essential.
The best work lives where the rules break down.

headline: The computer can't tell you the emotional story
body: **‚Äî Frank Zappa**
It can give you exact mathematical design, but what's missing is the eyebrows.
Creativity requires human emotion beyond technical precision.

headline: This is the real secret of life
body: **‚Äî Alan Watts**
Be completely engaged with what you're doing in the here and now.
Instead of calling it work, realize it is play.

headline: Care and Quality are internal and external aspects of the same thing
body: **‚Äî Robert Pirsig, Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance**
A person who sees Quality and feels it as they work is a person who cares.
Quality tends to fan out like waves.

headline: Art is anything you can do well. Anything you can do with Quality.
body: **‚Äî Robert Pirsig**
Quality is a direct experience independent of and prior to intellectual abstractions.

headline: Genius is courage in talent
body: **‚Äî Ludwig Wittgenstein**
Understanding is a public phenomenon. Meaning is use.
A great deal of creative thinking takes place in and with the materials of art.

headline: The SubGenius must have Slack!
body: **‚Äî Church of the SubGenius**
Too much is always better than not enough.
Bring your weirdest dreams to rampaging LIFE.

headline: Nothing is original
body: **‚Äî Austin Kleon, Steal Like an Artist**
All creative work builds on what came before.
What a good artist understands is that nothing comes from nowhere.

headline: Have no fear of perfection‚Äîyou'll never reach it
body: **‚Äî Salvador Dal√≠**
Ship it. Done is better than perfect.

headline: Sites that actually inspire
body: **[Dribbble](https://dribbble.com)** - UI/UX showcase, good for trends
**[Awwwards](https://awwwards.com)** - Best web design work, case studies on design systems
**[It's Nice That](https://itsnicethat.com)** - Creative industries news, graphic design, advertising
**[Creative Bloom](https://creativeboom.com)** - Illustration, art, design showcases
**[Mindsparkle Mag](https://mindsparklemag.com)** - Curated graphic/web/video design inspiration

headline: More places to look
body: **[AIGA Eye on Design](https://eyeondesign.aiga.org)** - Cultural news, interviews, fresh work
**[The Design Blog](https://thedesignblog.org)** - Focus on young and student designers, non-corporate vibes
**[Art of the Title](https://artofthetitle.com)** - Film title sequences (underrated inspiration source)
**[SaaS Pages](https://saaspages.xyz)** - Curated gallery of landing pages, headers, pricing that actually work

headline: Weirdo resources
body: **[FreeMediaHeckYeah](https://fmhy.net)** - Massive wiki of free resources for all your 'inspiration' needs
**[Craphound](https://craphound.com)** - Cory Doctorow's blog on tech, culture, and resistance
**[Internet Archive](https://archive.org)** - Deep web of historical design, typography, weird ephemera
**[UBUWEB](https://ubuweb.com)** - Avant-garde art, film, poetry archives

headline: Books and frameworks
body: **Steal Like an Artist** by Austin Kleon - Permission to be creative
**Atomic Design** by Brad Frost - Build modular design systems
**Thinking in Systems** by Donella Meadows - See the big picture
**Don't Make Me Think** by Steve Krug - Usability fundamentals

headline: You don't need expensive tools to make great work
body: Everything in this deck is free or has a solid free tier.
The cheat codes work regardless of your budget.
Ship stuff, steal smartly, and don't overthink it.
Now go make something cool.
